posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
What I can see immediately is that I wouldn't go for devcrit with a Warhammer, the threat range is just too small, not to mention that it's a 2-handed weapon for ya. Why not go shortsword instead? You can use a shield and will devcrit much more often. Also, you could consider swapping the last two stat increases, taking +1 STR before +1 CON to have more AB for longer. I don't have time to take a thorough look at it, but it also seems to me that you're spending many stat points in CON for Mighty Rage and EDR I, which may be a little too much investment for too little reward. This build is very similar to my HOOD build, maybe you can use it as reference?

http://nwnecbguild.44.forumer.com/the-h ... 15449.html

Take it EZ!

Thanx for reply, Max.

My build was inspired by this one: http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 10982.html
Either way, I wanted to take the biggest,largest possible weapon and place it in the hands of the smallest, slimmest, shortest, tiniest creature possible. To be truly an iconoclast, make your Halfling a female with the lithe model type. When the party says, "Cool, a Rogue! Can ya pick some locks?" you can unsheathe that hand-and-a-half sword and say, "No way. I'm the tank." They'll laugh at you at first, but I guarantee that after the first battle, they'll be asking "Uhh, so, what are you exactly?"
(c) grizzled_dwarflord
So, maybe I can somehow grab exotic weapon pro and take bastard sword instead of hammer, for some crit range and 1d10 base damage. But, sure, no schield.

By the way, I'll try to rebuild it a little soon.

posts.content:
Here's a tweaked version of the build. Choosing Gnome instead of Halfling helps with the high CON at the cost of DEX, which you don't use anyway, and the loss of Lucky, the Halfling's +1 saves boost. The +2 against fear is replaced with +2 against mind effects, which includes fear. The scimitar has a better critical threat range than the bastard sword, and doesn't require a proficiency feat. With your small size, Knockdown would be weakened, but if you must have it, replace Blind Fight and Toughness with KD and IKD and shuffle the feats around to take them when desired. UMD 20 is plenty for most purposes.

Compared to your second build, this build has +1 AB, +1 AC, +4 saves against spells, +1 Dev Crit DC, and +40 health, but slightly lower saves and -3 points damage reduction (12 instead of 15).

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Here you go, then. The loss of the boost to CON led me to make a difficult choice, not trying to make both STR and CON high. Compared to the last build, this let me increase STR by +4, as well as +4 DEX and +2 INT, in exchange for -6 CON, a net gain of +4 ability points.

Compared to my last build, this build has +3 AB, +2 AC, +2 on Dev Crit DC, +1 Will and +3 Reflex saves, and a maxed Listen skill to make it harder to sneak up on you, but you have a lot less health and you lose EDR and Mighty Rage, and -2 Fortitude saves.

If you want to, you can swap Armor Skin and Thundering Rage. Also if you want to, you can swap Exotic Weapons and Weapon Focus with Power Attack and Cleave. I did it the way I did because Cleave is very useful early on, when you only have one attack.

posts.author: TyrTemplar
posts.content:
Hey, cool build, D'Alessandro. Reminds me a lot of Finn's, as soon as I saw the small stature with the mighty, terrifying and thundering. Tweaked it for some more power there, and looks good (I think he'd be proud and with this we definitely have us here enough for a hunting party--heck, a whole tribe!!!

As to moving "RDD" sweet spots sooner, well, that depends. If you take 4 RDD pre-ep to get your first wave of sweetness, would also require a Bard level to do so meaning you'd lose not just 1 but 2 AB (BAB progression, which works in terms of the power of 4; once in epics, the table is set so doesn't matter any more). Also, if did that, would need another level of bard for a skills dump at 21, which would mess up your Barb/RDD set up--either that, or dump playability. Spread is great as she is. You "could" run your RDD straight through, run it to 10 ASAP but that would mean putting off mighty, which you grab as soon as you can (namely, Con/Str 21 and on a barb. level, hence delaying the Drakening, but that's fine). Technically, you can grab Mighty Rage as soon as you hit level 21 (that's 21st level, not 21 levels of Barbarian); however, can't do so here on account of the fact it requires STR/CON 21 as said, which you don't have by level 21. Could get there by Drakening pre-ep, but then, would lose the BAB / AB as said, so best as it is, I think. And with the Bard dump as soon as you hit the epic gate, the RDD coming on fairly quickly thereafter with a really nice skill set over-all as well as the HPs and soak, heh, mighty little tank alright.

Don't need toughness at all, but good you kept Blind Fight (that one is important, lets you fight invisible things--get to re-roll missed attacks, which is important). The KD/IKD helps you negate your size factor, so that's nice, too. Only thing is, how "committed" are you to thundering? I know Finn was, definitely has that "cool" factor on a Gnome for sure; but reason I ask is that, if you replace that say with epic prowess, will net you +1 AB (or, could take Armor Skin instead for +2 AC). With your Hps when capped raging, plus the EDR/barb soak, thinking the +1 AB will probably do you better so as to land the damage.

Your AB is good, but thinking +1 AB in light of the fact the warhammer doesn't crit much will do more for you to deliver even more damage (higher AB=hit more, and when you hit, you damage) than a boost to Ac in light of your high raging Hps and soak, depending always on your environs. Either way, Thundering is only activated when you're raging, and even then only comes in on a crit. Because the warhammer doesn't crit all that much really believe either EP or AS will do more for you, and which stay active all the time, not just when raging, right? Otherwise, really cool!

Rage ON! ~ Tyr
